p: We identified 91 and 87 plant, 14 and 17 vertebrate, and 53 and 29 invertebrate sequences in badger and fox samples, respectively (Fig.Â 2A). Sequences were identified to taxa at different taxonomic levels (Supplementary Table 4), and the taxonomic resolution of the three universal markers differed considerably. Taxonomic resolution was higher for vertebrates (33% and 43% of sequences identified to species level) compared to plants (7% and 8%) and invertebrates (20% and 13%) in badger and fox samples, respectively. Using the invertebrate marker, 32% of the sequences in badger, and 18% fox samples were only identified to taxonomic levels higher than order.
